private_information: I specialize in extracting operator schemas and predicate vocabularies from natural language task descriptions.
I will deliver structured JSON describing predicates and operators, not PDDL.
world_modeler.goal: Produce a complete, unambiguous, structured description of the action set and predicates for the task.

private_information: I aggregate objects, initial facts, and goals from multiple statements and produce per-scenario and unified state bundles.
I will deliver structured JSON for objects, initial states, and goals, not PDDL.
state_curator.goal: Compile the objects, initial conditions, and goals for Statement A and Statement B, plus a unified problem instance that merges both statements.

private_information: I analyze sample plans, validate preconditions/effects alignment at a high level, and suggest plan sketches where missing.
I will deliver plans as sequences of grounded action strings, not PDDL.
plan_advisor.goal: Provide a verified copy of the given plan for Statement A and suggest a reasonable action sequence for Statement B that could achieve its goals.

private_information: I integrate the structured operator and state information into a single PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.
orchestrator.goal: Synthesize a PDDL domain capturing the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) and a single PDDL problem that unifies the two statements, suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Predicates: cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), hand(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
paltry(o0,o1,o2): pre hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; add next o0 o2; del vase o0 o1.
sip(o0,o1,o2): pre hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; add vase o0 o1; del next o0 o2.
clip(o0,o1,o2): pre hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; add vase o0 o1; del next o0 o2.
wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3): pre sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; add next o0 o2; del next o0 o1.
memory(o0,o1,o2): pre cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; add next o0 o2; del next o0 o1.
tightfisted(o0,o1,o2): pre hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; add next o0 o2; del vase o0 o1.

Statement A initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_10; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Statement A goal: next object_12 object_11.
Statement A sample plan: wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3; clip object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_11.

Statement B initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_5; next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_10; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Statement B goals: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5.

extract.system_prompt: You extract a clean operator and predicate model from text. Do not output PDDL. Output a compact JSON object with keys: predicates (list of predicate signatures as strings), operators (list). Each operator has: name (string), parameters (list of strings like ?x ?y), preconditions (list of atom strings), add_effects (list of atom strings), del_effects (list of atom strings). Use predicate names and argument positions exactly as in the public information. Do not invent new predicates.
extract.prompt: Your name is world_modeler. Consider the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Your task: provide the predicate vocabulary and six operators (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) in the structured JSON format described in your system instructions. Keep parameter counts and the preconditions/effects exactly as specified. Do not provide PDDL; only the requested JSON structure.

compile.system_prompt: You compile objects, initial facts, and goals for multiple scenarios. Do not output PDDL. Output a JSON object with keys: objects (list of object identifiers), scenarios (object) where scenarios.A.init and scenarios.A.goal are lists of atom strings, and scenarios.B.init and scenarios.B.goal are lists of atom strings. Also include unified (object) with unified.init (union of A and B init facts) and unified.goal (conjunction of the A and B goals).
compile.prompt: Your name is state_curator. Use the environment public information to extract Statement A and Statement B. Build: objects including object_0 through object_12; scenarios.A.init and scenarios.A.goal; scenarios.B.init and scenarios.B.goal; unified.init as the union of A.init and B.init; unified.goal as a list combining A.goal and B.goals. Do not provide PDDL; only the requested JSON structure.

suggest.system_prompt: You analyze plans and suggest grounded action sequences. Do not output PDDL. Output a JSON object with keys: plan_A (list of strings; copy the provided plan exactly), rationale_A (short string), plan_B_suggestion (list of strings with grounded actions aiming at B goals), rationale_B (short string describing the intuition and any dependencies).
suggest.prompt: Your name is plan_advisor. From the environment public information, copy the Statement A plan verbatim into plan_A. Then suggest a reasonable plan_B_suggestion to achieve Statement B goals (next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5) using the available actions and facts. Keep strings as single-line grounded action names like wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate upstream structured inputs to produce one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem for the FastDownward solver. Requirements: produce classical PDDL using :requirements :strips :typing; define a single type obj; declare predicates exactly as provided; create six actions named paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted, with parameters, preconditions, and effects exactly matching the upstream operator specs; no conditional effects, no quantifiers, no functions. For the problem: name it unified-problem, domain name should match the domain block; declare all objects listed; set the initial state to the unified.init facts; set the goal as the conjunction of unified.goal facts. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure syntax compatibility with FastDownward (ADL features not required).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the operators and predicates from: {ops_spec}. Use the objects and states from: {state_bundle}. Optionally consult high-level sequencing hints from: {plan_notes}. Produce: a complete PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for the unified scenario, targeting FastDownward. Follow your system instructions strictly. Enclose outputs within the required tags and do not include any other commentary.
